title: Love Island Australia: How to tell twins Josh and Luke apart
text:
They're the identical twin brothers who sent pulses racing on Love Island Australia this week.

And while the female islanders were sent into a frenzy over Luke and Josh Packham's arrival on Tuesday, it appears fans are finding it difficult to tell them apart.

But while the pair, 25, have many similar features as each other, there is one noticeable difference between them - and it involves their nipples.

Causing a stir! Hot identical twins Luke (left) and Josh (right) sent pulses racing following their Love Island arrival on Tuesday

Upon close inspection of the boys, on Josh's right nipple lies a prominent birth mark across the centre of the areola.

It's visible in a number of his shirtless Instagram snaps, which he has proudly shared with fans.

However, his sibling's nipple is completely devoid of any mark - meaning they can be told apart in seconds.

Spot the difference! Josh (pictured) has a birth mark across the centre of the areola of his right nipple

There it is! Josh's birth mark is visible in a number of his shirtless Instagram snaps, which he has proudly shared with fans

It comes after Daily Mail Australia revealed the twins'previous profession - as male strippers.

Back in 2012, the pair - who were just 18 at the time - performed at hen nights and birthday parties on charter boats for Stallions Afloat.

Sources told Daily Mail Australia that the pair were incredibly popular with the ladies and were even nicknamed the 'Packing twins' for their impressive packages.

Prominent: Josh (pictured) used to do stripping before finding fame on Love Island alongside his brother

Despite making plenty of money stripping, the brothers gave up the lucrative gig around the age of 19 to pursue more stable careers.

Luke moved into landscaping, while Josh worked as a mortgage broker.

Love Island Australia continues Friday at 8.30pm on Channel Nine
description: They're the identical twin brothers who sent pulses racing on Love Island Australia this week.
authors: Nicole Douglas For Daily Mail Australia
